intro: Orthilia secunda var. obtusata, commonly known as the smooth orthilia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological studies and native garden landscapes.
